intro: Peponium bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate pumpkin, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squashes, and gourds. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits with a rough, spiny exterior. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The botanical features of Peponium bracteatum make it a notable species in horticultural and ecological studies.
